message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.NA, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with geometric objects (points on a sphere, convex hulls) and their approximation, which suggests that it belongs to the computational geometry (cs.CG) sub-category. The use of probabilistic methods and analysis of algorithms also suggests that it could belong to the data structures (cs.DS) and information theory (cs.IT) sub-categories. The mention of rescaling and distance-like functions suggests that numerical analysis (cs.NA) could also be a relevant sub-category. Finally, the mention of "complexity of approximations" suggests that the paper could also belong to the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category.
